intro: Nyssa wenshanensis, commonly known as the Wenshan Nutsack, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cornaceae. It is native to China, specifically the Yunnan Province, where it grows in subtropical forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a small, smooth, orange-red drupe that contains a single seed. Nyssa wenshanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
